name: Quintet
description: A cooperative, cross-platform, multiplayer scifi game where players control the same ship through 5 roles — Captain, Helm, Tactical, Engineering & Science. Battle with other player crews over the Internet.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or later Processor: Dual Core Memory: 2 GB RAM Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 150 MB available space

reviews.review_text: I backed this game on Kickstarter and it has come a long way. It is still a work in progress but if you play with friends it is very fun. It would be better with voice chat but you can use TeamSpeak. If you like Star Trek this is the game for you. Teamwork is a must. If your on a good ship with a good crew nothing is better.   P.S. The DLC is just actually buying the game. The free version is just the demo (which is still fun). You can also play on your Iphone or Android and the players playing on Mobile can play on the same ships as the players on PC and Mac.

I've been waiting for a game that did this kind of concept and, I think it did it pretty well. but the game still has a long ways to go but if the community grows bigger i'll try to be there every step of the way

Quintet is an excellent game that allows multiple players to command different parts of a single combat spaceship. It would be the perfect game for very large gaming guilds to use to face off against each other, since you only need one ship for every five players, meaning computing power could be dramatically reduced for the same number of players. Despite its simple design, it has very complex underlying systems that take a great deal of skill to utilize to their full potential while still being very forgiving to newcomers who do not yet fully understand how the systems work.

Good idea but done poor. There is no real teaching. Its just here's space with nothing to do. No end goal or objective. Also it seems to only want people on controller and screw over the keyboard and mouse. If you put something on pc it should be very keyboard friendly. I don't see any of the positive feedback for this game. Bad design with no idea how to play. It would fly back in the DOS age of games. But this is 2015 where more is expected.
DOOOOO ITTTTT!!!!!!!!!!

For anyone, like me and my friends, who thought this looked interesting - we were the only 3 players on last night. A 4th logged on, but never joined.   I can only assume this was popular once, and I also assume the developer(s) used this game to project themselves into the gaming industry - in which case bravo. This game is simple, but well formatted. Lacks a lot of content, but has a lot of ships.   I dunno, great for a LAN party if people still do those, but it's basically shoot each other until you're bored.

Honslty(I can't spell sorry) I think this is a good game I do hate you have to pay for project quintet and (some) scenerios.But other than that if you don't find aholes on your ship you'll most likely have a good time so its free2play look at it nothing to lose!

Honestly i could over look the graphics as that is not what makes a good game the controls for flying was not that bad what was real bad was the bad controls for all of the others mainly the gunner me and a friend spent almost a hour jumping around trying to kill anything and we could not kill a single ship even after shooting a afk for over 15 min we could not break past the shield so and it would keep kicking my friend from the ship and saying he got lost in space making us have regroup up and along with the lack of anything to do other then just fly and shoot it gets boring fast even eve online has more fun with it and that game you can kill someone wile making pancakes in the kitchen  Rate:4/10  PS: the ships stats are dumb only thing that changes is the specials they even all use the same guns have the same hp and same shields as each other (of the same tier bigger ships have more hp but same as other ships same size)
Good entertainment for 15 min lone wolfing it.
it sucks

Great game for an alpha. I personally hope that a currency or lvl/ranking system is created as there is no real point to play but to kill some time and have fun. Im looking forward to getting a ship with a buddy or two and going to some monday night tournaments.
This game beats all simulation games. It does. It really does. Play it. Kick all the ♥♥♥.
I would not recommend this game. As soon as I launched it, my nipples were turned inside out and a pentagram appeared on my ceiling.

this is not realistic and it's really boring! do not download
all you need is a tutorial
Really fun even just with the people you meet online, although its best with some friends in Teamspeak
Great Game, great and active developers. Unique play style, alone can be boring but with a team is glorious 9.30/10

The game looks fun but it want let me log in and every ten sec. a text will keep popping up and say you do not have internet and request that i go and play offline or lan but i want to play online.Can someone help?
I love the idea of this game. I had some chat related glitches but it was still very fun.
Fun but what are you meant to do no one plays pvp so what do you do...just fly around but i would love to see this go somewhere

Cute idea with balanced roles hidden under terrible design and a lack of focus. You pick between several crew positions of a ship comparable to the Enterprise and fly about blowing stuff up. That is all you do. The tutorial is hidden, the interphase is hideous and there's no reason to do anything. There is no salvage, no missions, not even an end goal. Just blow stuff up. Even the blowing up of stuff isn't very interesting as your aim wavers and you go so fast. I wouldn't recommend for more than half an hour or so.

Quintet is a great game based around team work and space stuff. With out the DLC I put in 17 hours with the DLC much more fun is too be had. Could do a better job for new players it took me 10 minuets to figure out how to launch my ship.  Pros: Fun with friends  Runs on any PC made in the last 10 years Unique gameplay lots to do Cons: Only ok by your self More people need to play this game
Great space game its good for nerds and geeks
Must have if you love space, great gamemodes amazing graphics i love it :) :) :)
Love it!
This is a very good game. Its sad that nobody really plays it anymore. everytime I go on nobody is there :(

Its a very good game, except the fact that almost no one plays it.  Trying to find a server to play on is almost imposible, its usually two people online at a time. The game is extremely well thought out though.
Amazing fun game to play with friends, although I wish DLC was free. Seems a bit limited after you get the hang of it. But still amazing anyway.
